Wave.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a woman who is a member of a US navy volunteer1 group
Wave.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a line of raised water that moves across the surface of the sea
Wave.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Dee watched the waves breaking on the shore.
The ship tipped over, and finally vanished beneath the waves.
Wave.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a sudden increase in a particular type of behaviour, activity, or feeling
Wave.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: There was a wave of public protest.
Wave.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a sudden increase in the number of people or things arriving at the same time
Wave.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: They faced wave after wave of fresh troops.
Wave.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: the form in which some types of energy such as light and sound travel
Wave.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: a movement in which you raise your arm and move your hand from side to side
Wave.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: He dismissed her with a wave of the hand.
Wave.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: a feeling or activity that happens again and again in a series
Wave.translation[1].definitions[5].examp: The pain swept over him in waves.
Wave after wave of aircraft passed overhead.
Wave.translation[1].definitions[6].defin: a loose curl in your hair
Wave.translation[1].definitions[7].defin: an occasion when many people who are watching an event stand up, move their arms up and down, and sit down again one after another in a continuous movement that looks like a wave moving on the sea
Wave.translation[1].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: a line of raised water that moves across the surface of the sea
Wave.translation[1].note_box[0].sections: We could hear the waves breaking on the shore.
Huge waves crashed down on us.
the sound of waves lapping against the boat
The ship sank beneath the waves.
The storm sent great waves crashing into the cliffs.
The winds and a tidal wave killed 45 people.
They spent a week on the ocean waves on a cruise ship.
Wave power involves using the movement of the seas to generate electricity.
Surfers rode on the crest of a wave.
Wave.translation[1].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 2: a sudden increase in a particular type of behaviour, activity, or feeling
Wave.translation[1].note_box[1].sections: The incident triggered a wave of violence.
A wave of relief washed over Harry.
Another wave of nausea hit him.
The city is experiencing a crime wave.
California is in the middle of a heat wave.
He was hit by a wave of nausea every time he tried to stand up.
The city was engulfed by a fresh wave of violence.
A sudden wave of joy swept over her.
A great wave of affection for him engulfed her.
A fresh wave of fighting erupted in the region yesterday.
Wave.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to raise your arm and move your hand from side to side in order to make someone notice you
Wave.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The nurses came out to wave Grandad goodbye.
She turned to wave to the approaching soldiers.
Enid waved at us and we waved back.
Wave.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: if you wave something, or if it waves, it moves from side to side
Wave.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: The starter waved a green flag to indicate that the race would begin.
a tree waving in the breeze
He waved a hand in the air to attract her attention.
Trudie waved a $50 bill under his nose.
The stranger spoke rapidly, waving his arms around.
Wave.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: to show someone which way to go by waving your hand in that direction
Wave.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: The border guards waved us through.
Peter waved them back to their seats.
Wave.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: if hair waves, or if it is waved, it forms loose curls
